intro: Biscutella laevigata var. asperifolia, commonly known as the roughleaf biscuitroot, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine, rough hairs, giving it its varietal name. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in early spring. The plant is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
